displayName.text: New York City Police Department - 9th Precinct

formattedAddress: 321 E 5th St, New York, NY 10003, USA
adrFormatAddress: 321 E 5th St, New York, NY 10003-8802, USA

originalText.text: Visited the 9th precinct to file a formal complaint. While taking our report, Officer Cepeda-Santana showed genuine empathy to my mothers situation. Her professionalism and patience assisting an elder while communicating fluently in Spanish helped keep my mom at ease. Officer Cepeda-Santana answered all our questions and even gave me a brief history lesson of the old 15 precinct. Her community expertise is what NYPD should strive for. Thank you officer Cepeda-Santana for making NY PROUD!

originalText.text: 9th Precinct officers came to Tanya Towers for a community meeting. They were very nice and professional, especially to the Deaf and Deaf-Visionally Impaired members. They answered many questions as the meeting time allowed. It was rather rough as too many of us sharing their safety concerns and how the officers would respond to our unique situations. I am very glad to find out that the text phone and the video phone are directed to the dispatchers . I feel much safer.

originalText.text:
I called the 9th precinct to complain about the noise level on my street at 12:40am on 10/12/17. I was told by a policeman earlier at 10pm that the "Bowery Jews", (which is a bunch of NYU Jewish kids dancing around) had a permit until 12am. I was like, ok, fine, let's hope the "party" will die at 12am.

Then, at 12:40am, I called the police station. The lady who picked up the phone was not helpful. She put me on hold. Then, she came back around to tell me that the "Bowery Jews" had their constitutional rights to practice their religion and their permit is extended to 3AM.

Are you serious??? Religious practice at 12:40am and extending to 3Am??? Are you blind to the senior citizen housing and all of the residential buildings on the streets and the neighborhood? And you allow them to "practice religion" until 3am and you tell me you couldn't do anything?

What a waste of time. For all those years I have lived in the East Village as an adult, I have never received any help from this police station and probably won't in the future.

What a disappointment! What a shame!!

originalText.text: I’d prefer to give them 0 stars. Needed help because my fiancé’s mouth was burning- we just wanted to reach to the police about this and help find the man that was involved in this long story, but the policemen made jokes out of the situation. what a helpful policemen they are. And for your information- me and my fiancé are not from NY.

originalText.text:
On 5/29/16,  at 7 pm, I went to the 9th Precinct to report a lost Iphone 5s.
I lost it, while shopping in the Astor Place Kmart.
The Police Officer that took my complaint was very kind, nice and  helpful.
He took all my information and said I should call back for a complaint #.
In the 1990's , I had worked at the 9th Precinct as a PAA and was surprised to see it had completely changed, everything looks modern and up to date.
The Apple ICloud Find My Iphone App, showed my phone offline.
But on 6/5/16, it showed my Iphone in the Lower East Side on Clinton Street. However, it still says that my Iphone is offline.
.
